article.headline: Michigan 83, Wofford 49
article.story: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) -- Courtney Sims scored 19 points and Dion Harris added 14 to lead Michigan to an 83-49 victory over Wofford on Saturday. Freshman DeShawn Sims had nine points for the Wolverines (8-1) who have held seven of their nine opponents to fewer than 60 points. Matt Estep scored 17 points and Matt O'Connor added nine for the Terriers (4-5). Wofford, a liberal arts school in South Carolina that plays in the Southern Conference, has never beaten a Big Ten team in four tries. Wofford, which briefly led 3-2, put itself into an early hole by relying on 3-point shooting. The Terriers attempted five 3-pointers to open the game but only hit one, allowing Michigan to go on a 9-0 run and take control. The Terriers' shooting struggles continued throughout the half, while Michigan hit 66.7 percent of its field goal attempts, including seven 3-pointers. The Wolverines went on to build a 43-18 halftime lead. The Wolverines, who led by as many as 37 points in the second half, did not allow Wofford to get any closer than 23 points and held the Terriers to 29.8 percent field goal shooting in the game. Michigan played without backup winger K'Len Morris, who is sidelined for three weeks with a separated left shoulder.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
